intro: Phyteuma vagneri f. brevibracteatum, commonly known as the short-bracted phyteuma, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and clusters of bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers. The leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, with a silver-green coloration. This subspecies is native to specific regions in southern Europe and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It blooms during the summer months, adding ornamental value to gardens and natural habitats.
